search.query: | inputlookup cs_indexes.csv | `cs_human_readable_time_format(last_event)` | table index, last_event, hosts, sourcetypes, status
| inputlookup cs_forwarders.csv | `cs_human_readable_time_format(last_connected)` | table hostname, forwarder_type, version, last_connected, os, arch, status

html.p: Displays information which is important for security, as well as the overall health of the Splunk environment.
Both the "Splunk Admin - Missing Data in the Index" and "Splunk Admin â€“ Missing Forwarder" alerts have to be enabled beforehand in order to populate this dashboard.
Both alerts are updated every hour.

Data from the Overview page might not match with the data in the Splunk Admin dashboard if any filtering has taken place on forwarders or indexers with either the cs_splunk_admin_missing_forwarders or cs_splunk_admin_missing_indexes_filter macros. This dashboard displays all forwarders and indexes found in your Splunk environment.
To remove a forwarder or index from this list, visit the "Differentiating Between Missing Indexes & Forwarders and Removed Indexes & Forwarders" section found here.

search.query: | rest /servicesNS/-/cyences_app_for_splunk/saved/searches count=0 splunk_server=local | search "eai:acl.app"="cyences_app_for_splunk" title IN ("Splunk Admin - Missing Data in the Index", "Splunk Admin - Missing Forwarder") | fields title, disabled | eval data=if(disabled=1, "Alert is disabled", "Alert is enabled") | rename title as label | table label, data

html.p: The information is updated on an hourly basis.
